name: Ty'r Graig Castle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just a weekend break here, on arrival we were greeted and our bags taken up to our room for us, which was nice, we arrived late so decided to eat there, the food was lovely, only thing for me was iam a vegetarian and only one dish on the menu goats cheese, which was lovely a nice pasta or something would also be great to add to the menu, so for the second night we decided to eat out as I didn't want goats cheese again, our room was lovely and clean, and a great balcony overlooking the sea, it did rain a fair bit so no sitting out. Staff very friendly and polite,overall a nice weekend break.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were very disappointed when we arrived at the Castle. As we pulled up first impression was that the building looked tired, there were 3 members of staff standing by the front door smoking, which does not give a good impession. We were shown to our room which was in the turret, the room had 3 windows giving views down to the beach, which were nice, but unfortunatly we had to close 2 of the blinds as the people in the next room had a balcony which came across our window, at one time our room and the room next door were one room and had been divided.The shower room was tiny, the top of the toilet cistern was held on with plastic ties. it was very small and had an electric toilet which when flushed made a munching noise, that seemed to go on forever, the lighting in there could be better. There was a plant in the lounge which was dead, and plastic flowers everywhere.
reviews.title: Great Hotel Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was ok , you had to make your own toast, we were offered tea or coffee, but it took 20 minutes for our cooked breakfast to arrive, by which time we had drunk our coffee. When we booked the hotel we were looking for something a bit different being a castle but sadly it was a disappointment.
reviews.title: I'm not quite sure!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My aunt and I stayed 2 nights in the two turret rooms. Very clean and spacious with lovely views. Good bathrooms and plenty of towels. Only negative is liquid soap. I really prefer a small bar of soap. Staff very helpful and welcoming and WiFi worked most of the time for me. Breakfast was a delight, with a view over the sea to die for. We did not venture out for dinner because the meals in the restaurant were too good to miss. Chef, Simon, really made dining a pleasure.
reviews.title: Quirky Victorian house

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very pleased with Ty'r Graig, This historic once private house has been converted with great sympathy retaining much of its original features and grandeur. It is never easy doing this with today's needs for fire, health & safety requirements and the shear practicalities of running a guest establishment but the owners have managed this in style.
reviews.title: A beautiful old house in a stunning location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was delicious, and served in the conservatory dining area where the views and sunset over the bay on a good weather day are enchanting.
reviews.title: anniversary bliss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All of the staff were helpful, attentive, friendly and couldn't do more to make us feel welcomed. The room was perfectly acceptable, clean and comfortable. We are looking forward to being able to stay here again the next time we are in the area.
reviews.title: Character but not charmed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can one say about an idyllic surrounding, peaceful and beautiful people as a bonus. The whole package was worth every penny. Greeted by the hotel manager Steve, who knew almost everything about the locality and the history of the hotel. Next time we will book a turret room just for the experience I think. Fabulous, fabulous, fabulous!!!! The hotel staff were wonderful and the 3 Romanian waiters were great and so friendly and helpful and able to interact with the guests, which is always a bonus we think.
reviews.title: barmouth stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a turret room. The hotel is situated about a 10 minute walk from Barmouth town centre. It's set back from the main road to Harlech, and has ample free parking. We were greeted by the hotel manager, Steve, who was very welcoming and showed us up to our room. The hotel is full of character and the reception includes a lovely stove, wood-panelled walls, original tiled floors, and stained-glass windows. From the reception we had fairly high expectations for our room, but were left a little disappointed. The room was quite small with a mish-mash of pine furniture. As expected from a turret room it was circular in shape and had several windows with great views over the town. The bathroom was unbearably small - my chin was resting on the sink when sat on the toilet, my husband had to come out of the bathroom in order to get dressed after a shower, and bending over the sink to brush my teeth caused the door to open. To cap it all the electric shredding toilet sounded very much like the opening riff to T Rex's 20th Century Boy (I know, it couldn't have been, as the band wouldn't have managed to fit in the bathroom!!).
reviews.title: Lovely quiet weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012
reviews.text: Really impressed by cleanliness and such a comfortable bed I wanted to take the mattress home. Lay on the bed and all I could see was sea and sky so restful. Service at breakfast was both friendly and efficient.
reviews.title: Spotlessly clean (not easy in a Victorian castle) beautiful views and such a comfortable bed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012
reviews.text: On arrival at the hotel we were welcomed by the owner who was lovely . She told us a little history of the beautiful old building and showed us the lounge and dining rooms where the view was impeccable . She then proceeded to show us to our turret room which was beautifully decorated with views to die for . The room was a little small but exceptionally comfortably . My partner is a light sleeper and slept soundly all night .
reviews.title: Warm welcoming and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was excellent again with fantastic views over the sea . Much more than we expected .
reviews.title: Beautiful Building, Lovely Staff, Highly Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a one night stay we did think a little overpriced but this would not stop us from staying here again . We would highly recommend it to our friends and family and look forward to another visit in the future
reviews.title: Stunning views for breakfast and lovely staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012
reviews.text: Thank you to you all x
reviews.title: High expectaions but very disapppinted

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I stayed here for 2 nights and we loved it. We were in a four poster room which was lovely and cosy with a gorgeous view of the ocean!
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff there are very attentive and friendly and the food was brilliant!! There's not one thing I can fault about this place. We'll definitely be coming back!!
reviews.title: wonderfull relaxing break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lovely short break comfortble hotel lovely. Welcoming hotel ,room with a veiw and belcony,freindly staff would stay again recomend .
reviews.title: Lovely stay

description: A landmark Victorian castle-hotel situated on the edge of Snowdonia National Park, overlooking Cardigan Bay. Approx. 1/2 mile out of Barmouth. An excellent base for anyone wishing to explore the surrounding areas. Recently described by a guest as 'an oasis of calm' it sits proudly between the mountains and the sea.
